title: Ford Plans to Pause F-150 Production at Missouri Plant Next Week
sub_head: The one-week suspension follows similar cuts earlier this month as auto makers deal with lingering chip shortage
body:
Ford Motor Co. said it plans to stop production of the F-150 pickup truck at a Missouri assembly plant for a week because of the global semiconductor-chip shortage, which continues to disrupt the automotive industry.
The move comes after the auto maker earlier this month stalled and trimmed production at several plants, including the one near Kansas City, Mo. Production of some of Fordâ€™s most popular vehicles has been affected by the cuts, including the Ford Bronco and Ranger.
